TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Click on the label '0- nitro phenol & p- nitro phenol' to start the experiment.
Take some Ortho Nitro Phenol and Para Nitro Phenol in a round bottom flask.
Add some water into it.
Place the RB flask in a heating mantle.
Take another round bottom flask, place it on a tripod stand.
Keep a filter funnel on the mouth of the RB flask.
Fill some water till the neck of the RB flask.
Remove the funnel.
Insert a cork.
Insert a glass tube into the RB flask.
Place an adapter on top of the RB flask in the heating mantle.
Attach a condenser and then a receiver as shown.
Place a conical flask filled with ice to collect the vapours.
Insert another glass tube to the RB flask on the tripod stand.
Insert a glass cork and then a glass tube through it into the RB flask in the heating mantle.
Connect the two flasks using a tube as shown.
Attach two tubes to the two outlets of the condenser and turn on the tap.
The condenser gets filled with water.
If you carefully observe, the water passes through the tube, fills the condenser and then comes out through one of the outlet. This process is to condense the condenser.
Set the temparature of heating mandle to 93ºC, turn on the burner too.
The Water vapour rises up and the conical flask gets filled with a green colour salt.

If you carefully observe, Water vapour rises up from the RB flask on the tripod stand, passes through the tube, enters the second RB flask and now the O-Nitro Phenol vapour rises up and passes through the condenser and get collected in the receiver conical flask in the solid form as shown.
Here, the O-Nitro Phenol vapour, when gets into the condenser get converted into liquid form due to condensation and get collected in the solid form in the conical flask due to the ice filled in it.
Take the conical flask.
Clamp a side arm conical flask to funnel stand.
Place a Buchner funnel on the mouth of the flask.
Put a piece of filter paper to the funnel.
Connect the thick wire of a hand vacuum pump to the side arm of the flask.
Put the green salt along with the ice to the flask, the pistol of the pump should be squeezed along with it. The water gets filled in the flask due to the vacuum filtration.
Take out the filter paper. We can observe that a thick layer of Ortho-Nitro Phenol is collected in the filter paper.
